comment: I tried this last night. It wasn't bad at all. It was very smooth and flavorful. The leading complaint I would have is that it may have been TOO flavorful, like too sweet with the vanilla. That's what I've heard about the maple and the apple Crown Royal as well. Either way, I'd gladly sip this again.

For a flavoured whisky? Not bad--a nice cream soda vanilla nose that doesn't go too far over into cloying artificiality, even if the taste is simultaneously too sweet and too watery, with no discernible rye character. I imagine this might punch up Coke to create an alcoholic vanilla Coke. On the other hand, vanilla Coke already exists. So. . . . For anything resembling actual whisky? It's borderline poison.

This is a pretty good flavored whisky. The vanilla leaves a bit of an aftertaste when drinking alone, but when mixed with coke it reminds me of Vanilla Coca-Cola. It's very smooth and better then the Crown Royal Apple.

Vanilla birthday cake batter on the nose. The palate rushes in swetness with a syrupy mouthfeel and notes of vanilla (duh), maple, and marshmallow. The finish is fleeting but leaves a lingering sweetness in the back of your throat. The flavor is tasty, but it's just too sweet save for the transitional whiskey drinker.
A Very good whiskey if your trying to impress a nice woman. smooth, sweet, and the scent is very inviting

Not what I prefer because it is to sweet for me and the ABV is low. This is a smooth mild spirit, we'll made and has a great price point about $30 USD for 750ml you can keep for yourself, give as a gift, or share with friends!
Mild sweet nose. Rich vanilla flavor with notes of sweetness. Sweet vanilla finish with a mild alcohol bite. Doesn't do well with Coke.
For a flavored whiskey I was actually nicely surprised. Very sweet by itself but mixed nicely

Fine as a mixer but on its own I find it to be too sickly sweet and artificial tasting. And this is coming from someone who loves vanilla. Stick to mixing with coke and you’ll have a great experience, but don’t attempt to drink this one on its own.
Not my fav straight but not terrible with coke. I tried a sample and probably won't buy a bottle.
It tastes very good, but way too sweet. It is best served as desert vs a sipper. I am glad this was not around when I was in high school.
Not bad but too sweet for my taste. Goes better with dessert.

A drink for the kidlets when they're just starting out.

Nothing fancy, complex or interesting about this whisky. It's pure sugar and not good on the palate, especially at 35% ABV. If the sugar was dialed back and the ABV ramped up, then you might ...keyword, "might" consider this one.

Finger in mouth.
What I’d call a ‘dessert whiskey’. Very good. But sweet. A lot of vanilla.
Very sweet. But that’s just the way I love it.
Extremely sweet to the taste. Great sipping ability. It’s good with coke. Very smooth to the tongue and a bit of a spicy aftertaste. Very little bite. Great with a couple of ice cubes in a glass.
Something different. It’s nice on the palate and has very little aftertaste. The vanilla is subtle but still noticeable.
Not the full vanilla and sweetness expected. Expected creamy vanilla and received some vanilla without the creamy backbone. Not a fan of the type of vanilla flavor used.
Great vanilla taste that's not over powering.
This was a mistake, huuuge nope! Smells like medical ointment. Tastes as bad as it smells. Yeech!
First taste definitely sweet, vanilla ice cream..  finish ends up a bit bland with a dulling aftertaste.  Sugar sugar sugar...
Vanilla flavor takes a few sips to taste. Not as good as Peach
Very aromatic and light on burn. Smoothest whiskey with a hint of vanilla that mixes perfectly with any add-in.
God this is bad. It’s like someone dumped sugar cubes into a crappy bottle of bourbon.
Not as bad as I thought.  It is actually good for mixed drinks.
Sweetness overload, but I like it. Great summer drink for OTR, mixed with coke, or straight  up. Cheap and easy to find.
Good with a Coke?? Very sweet.
Should be ok in a mixed drink. Was great when used in cooking a dessert.
